body_html:
Can you post a separate issue for the "conda install -c caffe2 caffe2-cuda9.0-cudnn7" failure so that other users with the same problem can find it?

For the first issue, you need to install gflags into your conda environment and pass -DCMAKE_PREFIX_PATH=/home/forestriveral/anaconda3/envs/caffe2 as well. There's an explanation for why you need to do that https://caffe2.ai/docs/getting-started.html?platform=mac&configuration=compile#custom-anaconda-install . You can also find some useful info on how Caffe2 works with Anaconda here https://caffe2.ai/docs/faq.html#why-is-caffe2-not-working-as-expected-in-anaconda , and you can find an explanation of your specific failure case here caffe2/caffe2#1980 . That issue specifically refers to protobuf, but you have the same problem with gflags instead. If you do install gflags and still get the issue, then you may have to try installing different conda gflags packages (e.g. different versions or channels, switching between default conda channels and conda-forge is usually all you need) until you find one with the right abi; https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/blob/master/scripts/read_conda_versions.sh is a script I wrote a few months ago to help me find compatible protobuf and opencv conda versions; maybe it can help you find a good gflags version.
